name: stoic2a
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3
comment: Stoic logic Thema 2 version a. Statement T2 of [Bobzien] p. 117 shows a reconstructed version of Stoic logic thema 2 as follows: "When from two assertibles a third follows, and from the third and one (or both) of the two another follows, then this other follows from the first two." Bobzien uses constructs such as ` ph , ps |- ch ` ; in Metamath we will represent that construct as ` ph /\ ps -> ch ` . This version a is without the phrase "or both"; see ~ stoic2b for the version with the phrase "or both". We already have this rule as ~ syldan , so here we show the equivalence and discourage its use. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 17-Feb-2019.)
